Volunteer Coordinator: Charles Labun, Program Coordinator; Phone: 1.866.902.3767; Email: csicoli@uvic.ca
Service Details: - FREE scientific evidence-based, health education programs delivered by trained program leaders that provide information, tools and practical skills on managing chronic health conditions- Increases the confidence and motivation people need to better manage the challenges of living with a chronic health condition, pain, Diabetes or Arthritis/Fibromyalgia- Participants share in a safe and confidential environment and give and receive support from others who are experiencing similar health issues- Programs are highly interactive, fun and not a 'sit-and-listen' lecture format- Trained leaders meet with groups of 10-14 persons for 2 1/2 hours once each week for six consecutive weeks- Participants are provided with an accompanying resource text(s) and resource materials at no cost- Family members and caretakers are also welcome to attend
Eligibility: Ages: 19 year(s) and up- Workshops are offered once per week over six consecutive weeks (2.5 hrs/week)- Registration is FREE but mandatory- Must register early as workshops may be cancelled if a minimum number of persons do not pre-register- Plan to commit to all six sessions as these are not 'drop-in' workshops
How to Apply: Call the toll-free number or visit the website for more information
Meetings: - Offered in the Central Okanagan- Visit http://www.selfmanagementbc.ca/upcomingworkshops, then select Interior Health for listings of workshops and Leader Trainings
Print Material: - Brochures and information sheets are available- Please call toll free number for information
